intro: Cyclamen peloponnesiacum subsp. rhodense, commonly known as the Rhodense cyclamen, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Peloponnese region of Greece. It features heart-shaped, velvety leaves with a distinctive wavy margin and produces clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or shaded woodland areas. Its blooming season typically occurs in late winter to early spring, making it a valuable early-flowering plant. Cyclamen peloponnesiacum subsp. rhodense is also notable for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
